page.title: 15FARMING
page.content: In our square there are 5 large farms. The crops that are grown are winter and spring wheat and winter and spring barley.Some of the farm land is managed grassland from which silage and hay are also cut.Some of the less fertile hillier parts are used for rearing sheep.The most common breeds are mules and Suffolks. Manor farm is a mixed farm.It has a dairy herd of about 150 Friesian cows and one bull is kept.There is a flock of 700 sheep.Five men work on the farm including the dairy man. Pheasants are reared at several places in the area.The chicks are sold in late summer to restock the woods on large farms and estates.
